messages.subject: Wakizashi for Sale
messages.msgSnippet: For sale is a Shinshinto wakizashi by Ryusaishi Masashige. Information and images are available at the following link.
messages.messageBody:
For sale is a Shinshinto wakizashi by Ryusaishi Masashige. Information
and images are available at the following link.

http://www.nihontokanjipages.com/personal/masashige/ryusaishi-masashige.html

Further information can be obtained from me at ikkanshi@...

Thanks for looking.

regards

Richard Turner

messages.messageBody:
Hi Tom, that's great information thanks and yes it all makes sense. I
wonder if you could email me the image direct as they are stripped from
these threads.

Cheers mate

Richard

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Iron Tsuka
messages.msgSnippet: Richard et al - This is known as a Tsutsugane tsuka, the metal piece being like a gun barrel (tsutsu). It is also called a dôgane. Originally a simple band to
messages.messageBody:
Richard et al -
This is known as a Tsutsugane tsuka, the metal piece being like a
gun barrel (tsutsu). It is also called a dôgane. Originally a simple
band to reinforce a plain wooden handle on a koshigatana, therefore
they are most often seen on wakizashi and tanto koshirae. Taira
Tadamori brother of Kiyomori is known to have worn a sword with this
kind of tsuka. I believe we see a lot of these from late-Edo early
Meiji as that was a time of revival of all things classicly samurai
such as swords and sugata from the Kamakura era. If that makes sense...
-t
(this info courtesy of Fukunaga Suiken BTW)

>

messages.subject: Iron Tsuka
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all, I am unsure of the history of this type of koshirae. It has been in my collection for some time now but sadly I have not really looked into it too
messages.messageBody:
Hi all, I am unsure of the history of this type of koshirae. It has been
in my collection for some time now but sadly I have not really looked
into it too closely.

This tsuka is made of iron, and has silver iroe of a plum flower on a
branch. The Kashira looks Higo and is also Iron with gold Iroe, and the
Fuchi I am unsure though it looks low end, has small gold droplets on it.

This came from a sword dated 1805. I assume it to be from around a that
time before that though (one should never assume I know) as it has been
remounted several times and the core has only mekugi ana. This mekugi
ana is the ana for the above mentioned sword.

Any offerings appreciated.

Cheers

Richard
